alert.note: Alert for Delaware (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 6:26PM EDT until April 01 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MONTGOMERY...CHESTER AND NORTHWESTERN DELAWARE COUNTIES... At 626 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Glenmoore to Glen Roy, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... West Chester, Coatesville, Westtown, Downingtown, Conshohocken, Kennett Square, Oxford, Parkesburg, West Grove, Honey Brook, Homeville, Glen Roy, Cochranville, Cheyney, Mount Vernon, Marshallton, Radnor Township, Lionville-Marchwood, Gradyville and Valley Forge. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 302 and 330. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 334. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 11 and 18. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern Delaware...and southeastern Pennsylvania. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
